package.name: sfPropelActAsCommentableBehaviorPlugin
package.description: This behavior permits to attach comments to Propel objects. It provides a module for enabling comments in your application in less than 3 minutes.
package.notes: * fixed XSS bug (closes #3745) * switched documentation to the markdown syntax * added a "website" field * fixed "duplication of DOM id sf_comment_list" bug (closes #3258) * allowed formatting in comments (closes #2900): * introduced a ``sfPropelActAsCommentableStripper`` class * use of [HTMLPurifier](http://htmlpurifier.org/) * fixed "title not saved" bug (closes #3086)

release.notes: * fixed XSS bug (closes #3745) * switched documentation to the markdown syntax * added a "website" field * fixed "duplication of DOM id sf_comment_list" bug (closes #3258) * allowed formatting in comments (closes #2900): * introduced a ``sfPropelActAsCommentableStripper`` class * use of [HTMLPurifier](http://htmlpurifier.org/) * fixed "title not saved" bug (closes #3086)

* compatibility with escaping=both mode * Added unique DOM id for each comment, in the form {{{sf_comment_$id}}} (Nicolas Perriault) * use a session token instead of passing the object id and model in the request (Nicolas Perriault) * bugfixes, based on a patch from Michael Nolan (closes #2595): * fix anonymous posting (use the token) * pre and post addition hooks
* added namespaces support * fixed bad index names (thanks to francois) * made getComments() more flexible (closes #2312, thanks to FrankStelzer)
* added a Symfony module for posting and displaying comments * ajax support * authenticated users support * form customization * added an administration module
Initial public release. Features comments attachment to heterogene Propel objects.
